main_definition: Better is a comparative form of the word 'good' that signifies improvement or superiority in quality, performance, or condition compared to another.

meanings_and_examples.example: After revising my essay several times, I have a better version that addresses the previous flaws.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Superior quality or condition compared to another
meanings_and_examples.example: My current job pays less but provides me with a better work-life balance than my last position.
This restaurant offers better food at a more affordable price compared to others in the area.

meanings_and_examples.definition: More suitable or appropriate for a particular purpose or situation
meanings_and_examples.example: With her experience, she is better suited to handle this project than anyone else on the team.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Better in terms of physical fitness or health condition
meanings_and_examples.example: I feel much better after a good night's sleep and a nutritious breakfast.

meanings_and_examples.definition: More satisfactory or enjoyable compared to past experiences
meanings_and_examples.example: This movie is so much better than the last one we watched; it had great acting and an engaging storyline!
